page.syntax: Result as P = a5_adoimporttable(C ConnectionString ,C TableOrSQL ,C DBFTableName [,C Fields [,C Username [,C Password [,L lSilent [,L lBatch [,L lOverwrite [,L SizeToFit [,L TimeAsDate [,C cArgs [,L flagForceSQL ]]]]]]]]]])

argument.name: Result
argument.description: A dot variable containing the following elements.

item.name: ErrorText
item.description: A character message returned by the ADO database or the script.

item.name: Script
item.description: The script that generated the result table.

argument.name: ConnectionString
argument.description: The connection string required to establish a connection to the database.

argument.name: TableOrSQL
argument.description: The name of the ADO database table to open or the SQL SELECT statement that retrieves the data.

argument.name: DBFTableName
argument.description: The path and name of the table to create.

argument.name: Fields
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". A comma delimited list of fields to retrieve or empty string for all fields.

argument.name: Username
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The user name required to log on to the database.

argument.name: Password
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The password required to log on to the database.

argument.name: lSilent
argument.description: Optional. Default = .F. (False). When set to .T. (True), the function will not display errors or prompts, such as "Overwrite existing table?". Logical

argument.name: lOverwrite
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. (False). When set to .T. (True), the function overwrites existing tables without prompting. When set to .F. (False), and Silent is .T., the function will not import the table is the result table already exists.

argument.name: SizeToFit
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. (False). After importing, resize the fields in the result table to be as small as possible. For example, if a field has a length of 50, but the longest item in this field is only 10 characters, the field length will be adjusted to 10 plus a 2 character pad.

argument.name: TimeAsDate
argument.description: Optional. Default = .F. (False). By default, the function imports Date/Time fields as Time (T) fields. When set to .T. (True), the function imports these fields as date (D) fields. Logical

argument.name: cArgs
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". Arguments for a dialog box. Refer to the Xbasic code generated by A5_ADOImportTable() for an example.

page.description: Import an ADO Table. Fields is a comma delimited list of fields or empty string for all fields.
page.discussion: The A5_ADOImportTable() function retrieves data from an ADO compatible database or Excel spreadsheet and creates an Alpha Anywhere table.
